p: Guayule has much inherent genetic variability: plants with chromosomes numbers from 2n = 36 to 100 are known [ 16]. The guayule types 2n = 36 reproduce sexually with pollination [ 16]. It can be both wind and insect pollinated [ 15]. The others, “apomicts”, reproduce without requiring double fertilization: the embryo of the seed arises from a non-fertilized nucleus and grows genetically identical to the parent. Hybrids with useful characteristics can be developed [ 16].
